channel.title: Blech – Future and past Blech events
channel.description: Recent content in Future and past Blech events on Blech

item.title: Blog: Synchron 2021
item.description:
A prototypical implementation for extracting and visualizing mode diagrams expressed in the synchronous control-flow of Blech activities has been presented at Synchron 2021 the 27th International Open Workshop on Sychronous Programming held in La Rochette 45km south east of the centre of Paris, France.

On Wednesday, 2021-11-24 , Reinhard von Hanxlden talked about Extracting Mode Diagrams from Blech Code .

The prototypical implementation has been done by Daniel Lucas in his master thesis . A research paper on this topic has been publish at the 2021 Forum on Specification, Verification and Design Languages

item.title: Blog: Synchron 2020
item.description:
The Blech modules system has been presented at Synchron 2020 the 27th International Open Workshop on Synchronous Programming. Synchron 2020 has bee organized as a distributed synchronous systems (Online Workshop) on November 26-27 2020.

On Thursday, 11-26-2020, Friedrich Gretz talked about Implementing true separate compilation - the Blech module system ).

item.title: Blog: FDL 2018
item.description:
At FDL 2018 , the Forum on specification & Design Languages, in Munich, Germany, Blech has been presented to the public for the first time.

In his keynote Blech - a safe synchronous language for embedded real-time programming , Franz-Josef Grosch motivated and illustrated (slides) the requirements and the - at that time planned - features of Blech to bridge the gap between model-based control engineering and modern software engineering.

item.title: Blog: Memocode 2017
item.description:
At Memocode 2017 the 15th ACM-IEEE International Conference on Formal Methods and Models for System Design held at Technische Universität Wien in Vienna, Austria, the ideas of an imperative synchronous language, later called Blech, have been presented.

The motivation was and is to create an imperative synchronous language that bridges the gap between model-based control engineering and software engineering.

In his keynote , Franz-Josef Grosch showed how the Blech team intended to Elevate embedded real-time programming with a synchronous language .

item.title: Blog: Synchron 2019
item.description:
Blech has been presented at Synchron 2019 the 26th International Open Workshop on Synchronous Programming in Aussois, November 25-29 2019.

On Tuesday, 2019-11-26 Friedrich Gretz talked about Programming Blech .

item.title: Blog: WCET 2019 Keynote
item.description:
The keynote of WCET 2019 the 19th International Open Workshop on Worst-Case Execution Time Analysis, presented Blech - a synchronous language for embedded real-time programming

The talk was given by Franz-Josef Grosch, abstract and slides are available.
